title: Since Ap magewick got horribly nerfed from the removal of dfg
body:
Can Warwick gain an Ap ratio on his ult?

It wouldn't be gamebreaking

It would just allow me not to rush Nashor's

replies.body: If DFGaren doesn't get compensation, magewick doesn't either.

> [{quoted}](name=Hellioning,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VeAmgf6L,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2015-04-26T19:10:57.313+0000)
>
> If DFGaren doesn't get compensation, magewick doesn't either.

You don't want "compensation" {{champion:45}}
{{champion:78}} Poppy wants a higher ap ratio due to the removal of dfg.
NO. HELL NO.
DFG removal was a significant nerf to AP Poppy, since "Everything is viable on Poppy"—Phreak, EU Challenger series fall 2014.
Urf Poppy Nuff said.

Warwick is not supposed to be AP

I like a lot exotics builds and playstyle but you shouldn't dream, exotics ones will never get changes for the simple reason that they are just EXOTICS and not supposed to be the main playstyle.
If he was not supposed to build AP, why have any ap ratios on him at all?

> [{quoted}](name=Fluffysaurus Rex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VeAmgf6L,comment-id=00040001,timestamp=2015-04-26T20:25:10.410+0000)
>
> If he was not supposed to build AP, why have any ap ratios on him at all?

So he could buy {{item:3078}} {{item:3025}} and get something from the AP, also baron buff, also magewick is cancer, his sustain is balanced for AD not the 1.0 AP ratio spam nuke to heal you.
Then, why would a small AP ratio on his ultimate be that bad? It just means that a stat isn't completely wasted.

> [{quoted}](name=Fluffysaurus Rex,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=VeAmgf6L,comment-id=0004000100000000,timestamp=2015-04-26T21:15:19.762+0000)
>
> Then, why would a small AP ratio on his ultimate be that bad? It just means that a stat isn't completely wasted.

Because it already scales off enough things, it scales off AD, On-hits, Magic Pen, every level (w/his passive), and benefits from lifesteal & CDR. 

It doesn't need more scaling.
It is like auto attacks which scales with AD, attack speed, Crit, Armor pen, On-Hits, Lifesteal... we should remove some of the scaling on auto attacks they scale with too much stuff....
Except your auto attacks don't stop a person from moving or attacking unless and simultaneously heal you and let you deal damage unless they build a specific item or someone else stops the ult.

Except that auto attacks doesn't prevent the user/caster (warwick) from moving either and they don't have a long cooldown and can almost be used at any time
And auto attacks deal all of their damage instantly and it doesn't require a channel to finish like Warwick ult does

Because that's how you balance things sometimes. Similarly to Trist's old kit that had nothing but AP, Tryn's E and Q still have AP ratios, Hecarim's W and R have AP ratios, Varus's W and R have AP ratios... I can keep going if you'd like about all the champs with AP ratios on AD champions that would be utterly broken if they were AD instead. It's to give these champions the ability to increase their overall damage output when they get Baron without completely making them broken or to open up the ability of grabbing a TrinityPhreak, or other thing that gives AP. Like Sona's old Q and Taric's ult. :3
His recommended build is AP lol
I wouldn't mind that, It wouldn't be insanely op. As long as it was a really low AP ratio, like starting out .05 up to .15 (since it stacks three times) but really even that might be too much. idk

Agreed

+1
This is what I was going to say but I would feel I would get downvoted

I don't think an AP ratio on his ultimate would be that bad, and it would open up more variability in builds.

On an off topic, does his passive on-hit magic damage count as spell damage?
Don't think so. Otherwise, people would be building him like Teemo.
I would, I would...
AP Warwick can still heal upwards of 900 with a Q (Spirit visage), AP WW is fine, the ult should just be used for a gapclose.

I play ap warwick all the time. Before and after Dfg, I never got dfg on him. Just going {{item:1076}} {{item:1076}} {{item:1001}} {{item:3089}} is good enough for your first items, gives you decent mana sustain in lane and huge burst/heals with Q. After that I usually finish boots or instantly go into a {{item:3115}}  or{{item:3100}}.
Eventually getting both items. Nashors gives the AP ratio to your ultimate and lich bane procs instantly on first attack with your ultimate. With those 3 items its pretty easy to 100 to 0 anyone in my experience.

Basically im saying DFG was never needed and still isn't.

Also to note, just the Deathcap gives me easy 1v1 potential. Auto a couple times, q after you've taken damage, ult, q when ults over. With an {{summoner:14}} somewhere in there. I usually play Ap warwick in top lane as well.
Please don't get him ... 'compensated'.
I've been asking for AP ww buffs since dfg was removed...
Well this is your shot ;)
No. It was never fun being two shotted by magewick. He should have never existed.

{{item:3020}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3100}} {{item:3115}} {{item:3146}} {{item:3157}} work just fine with me. Q followed by Lich Bane proc basically assassinates most squishies. Sometimes {{item:3001}} is also a good option considering that none of Warwick's magic damage can be inflicted outside of its aura anyway.
Magewick doesnt need buffs at all. He's still solid AP, and anyone building DFG on ap warwick was bad i the first place.

I don't think ww needs any help after DFG (honestly that item was a crutch more than anything skillful). I still play him as ap and will still do good with him because my build never focused on being DFG focused and it never will. WW scales so good with magic pen and spellvamp (gunblade is too good to pass up considering how hard his ulti scales on AD). when the sky always has stars at night, and you goto into a city do the stars disappear because you can't see them anymore? Same goes to how you build ap ww, if you can't figure a build out, you clearly aren't thinking deep enough about how the abilities interact with everything.

But his passive does need something more, same with gp's who does litterly zero damage late game (im not kidding his passive can't hurt you)
didnt realize people got DFG on magewick... always built magewick without it tbh.. so its removal doesnt change anything for me :l
or we could rove his ap ratios and give him a buff else where
I never built DFG on him, I basically built him tank but with more AP items.

Oh, he got compensated before they removed DFG!

Remember? When they essentially removed the damage on his ult? Its keeping with the theme of Veigar.
Only if MF can get an AD ratio on the physical part of her ultimate.
